alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding is possible from a combo of snowmelt and rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of Northeastern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas of streams with limited impacts on roadways at this time. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 924 AM EDT, Stream and river levels in the advisory area still remain high due to runoff from recent rains the melting of the last of the remnant snow pack. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Presque Isle, Caribou, Houlton, Fort Fairfield, Limestone, Van Buren, Mapleton, Washburn, Mars Hill, Hodgdon, Easton, Woodland, Island Falls, Bridgewater, Smyrna, Amity, Haynesville, Scopan, Dudley Township and Smyrna Mills. - Streams currently most affected are the Presque Isle stream near Presque Isle, the Little Madawaska stream near Caribou, and the Meduxenkeag near Houlton, which are both currently at minor flood stage. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown if you encounter any flooded roads traversing stream lowland benches. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When there is a potential of lowland flooding. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks to avoid this flooding.
